text: Henry Reginald Yorke (30 October 180326 September 1871)Death of the Hon. and Ven. H. R. Yorke. The Times (London, England), Thursday, 28 September 1871; p. 6; Issue 27180 was Archdeacon of Huntington from 22 March 1856 to 16 March 1870. The son of Joseph Sydney Yorke, he was born in Bursledon,educated at St John's College, Cambridge and ordained in 1827. He held incumbencies at Aspenden and Wimpole; was a JP for Cambridgeshire; and a Canon at Ely Cathedral from 1859 until his death; he was granted, with his brother's succession to the peerage (in 1834), the style and precedence of the younger son of an earl.Mosley, Charles (ed.) Burke's Peerage, Baronetage & Knightage, 107th edition, vol. 1. (Wilmington, Delaware: Burke's Peerage (Genealogical Books) Ltd, 2003). p. 470. His brother (Charles Yorke, 4th Earl of Hardwicke) was a British naval commander and Conservative politician; and his brother-in- law — Robert Cooper Lee Bevan — an eminent banker.Our History. Christ Church, Cockfosters. Retrieved 21 July 2015. ==References== Category:1803 births Category:People from the Borough of Eastleigh Category:Alumni of St John's College, Cambridge Category:Archdeacons of Huntingdon Category:1871 deaths
title: Henry Yorke (priest)
